generalInfo:
This holiday for 14 days in Myanmar will give you a chance to learn an interesting history lesson with the great culture and religion of the Buddhist for the travelers with their owns family. The well-organized program with unique places for the family will be just a book for your treasured memories of the trip to the Golden Land.

All the places in each destination will create the treasured memories of your family and the locals that you will meet on the tour will give you the warmest greeting and share stories of their daily life. All the great cities will offer different experiences and feelings for your family trip.

We will begin the tour with the heart of Yangon, the glorious Shwedagon Pagoda. Continue visiting the classic regions, Bago and Golden Rock then we can enjoy the essence of authentic and unique Myanmar in the sacred pilgrimage site and the richest archeological sites.

The Burmese architecture will vary from each city and an array of temples at ancient city, Bagan, is sure of your interests because all temples are being revealed the Buddhist history and enlightened the history of Myanmar Kingdom. Exposing the locals, observing the local housing and inspecting the villagers' daily routine are definitely a delightful diversion of the Bagan.

Next, starting with Maha Muni Pagoda, famous for its life like Buddha image; Marble Sculpture; Tapestry Workshop and Zeygyo Market, enjoying the sunset at U Bein Bridge is the good changes as a part of the trip in Mandalay. The local train ride to the charming town, Madaya, through the villages and picturesque paddy fields and strolling through the local market (Thu Ye Zay) by seeing the various seasonal fruits and fresh vegetables are very worth spending time and capturing the locals' daily routine for the lives.

In Inle Lake, the hospitality of the locals and hosts while we are discovering in floating islands and gardens in Inle will remain in our thoughts as good memories. And by an excursion to one of the most remarkable sights in Shan State, for a lot of stupas and a cluster of the fantastic ancient monument, we can have more time to learn about the pilgrimage site. It features a neat row sprawling over the hillside.

Spending most of the time by interacting with the locals, experiencing the different culture of ethics and trying the different traditional cuisines are the best spots of 14 days tour. Since Myanmar offers many breathtaking temples, Pagodas, small villages, statues and vibrant cities, it is sure that after the trip, your family will think that they have gone "above-and-beyond" with this 14 days tour.
